Section 1 Problem Set 1 Due: ???? 1.1 Modular Multiplication Make the multiplication tables of the following sets and determine which of them are groups under multiplication: \(\{1,2,3\}\) using multiplication mod 4 \(\{1,2,3,4\}\) using multiplication mod 5 \(\{1,5,7,11\}\) using multiplication mod 12 1.2 Outer Cancellation A group \(\mathsf{G}\) has the special property that for all \(x,y,z \in G\), if \(xy = zx\) then \(y = z\). Prove that \(\mathsf{G}\) is abelian. 1.3 Two-by-two mod 2 Let \(\mathsf{G}\) be the group of all invertible \(2\times 2\) matrices with entries from \(\mathbb{Z}_2 = \{0,1\}\) and all arithmetic done mod 2. That is, \[ \mathsf{G}= \left\{ A=\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix} \mid a,b,c,d \in \{0,1\} \hbox{ and $A$ is invertible} \right\}. \] The operation is usual matrix multiplication with arithmetic done mod 2 so that: 0+0 = 0, 0+1 = 1+0 = 1, 1+1 = 0. There are 16 matrices of this form (two choices 0 or 1 for each of the four matrix entries), determine which of these are invertible. Then make the multiplication table for this group. 1.4 Distributing Powers Prove that for \(a, b\) in a group \(\mathsf{G}\) we have \[ (ab)^2=a^2b^2 \quad \hbox{ if and only if } \quad ab=ba. \]

Section 3 Important Definitions 3.1 Groups 3.1.1 Group A group is a set \(\mathsf{G}\) with a binary operation \(\ast\) that satisfies the following: (Identity) There exists \(e \in \mathsf{G}\) such that \(e \ast g= g \ast e = g\) for all \(g \in \mathsf{G}\). (Inverse) For all \(g \in \mathsf{G}\), there exists \(g^{-1} \in \mathsf{G}\) such that \(g \ast g^{-1} = g^{-1} \ast g = e\). (Associativity) \((ab)c = a (bc)\) for all \(a,b,c \in \mathsf{G}\)
